intro: Pasania echinothola, commonly known as the spiny pasania, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often covered in fine hairs. Pasania echinothola is often found in rocky or sandy soils and can thrive in semi-arid environments.
